      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean isAllowed(ChessPiece piece, int toRow, int toColumn)
      This the same method as the allowed method, however, instead of it counting for no piece on the way to the destination, it will make sure there is exactly one piece, and therefore the piece jumps on one piece
      boolean isLegalCaptureMove(int toRow, int toColumn)
      if a canon is capturing, it needs to jump exactly one piece before capturing another piece
      boolean isLegalNonCaptureMove(int toRow, int toColumn)
      The canon can move any number of pieces vertically or horizontally so long as there is no piece in the way

      • isAllowed

        public static boolean isAllowed(ChessPiece piece,
                                int toRow,
                                int toColumn)
        This the same method as the allowed method, however, instead of it counting for no piece on the way to the destination, it will make sure there is exactly one piece, and therefore the piece jumps on one piece
        Specified by:
        isAllowed in interface StraightMove
        Parameters:
        piece - the piece that will perform this move
        toRow - the destination
        toColumn - the destination
        Returns:
        true if there is exactly one piece between the piece and the destination
